name: expedite
content:

Add to word list
to make something happen more quickly: Something needs to be done to expedite the process.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to get fasterspeed upThe car sped up to 100 mph.pick up speedThe hurricane is picking up speed as it approaches the coast.gain speedAccidents often happen when a driver gains speed going downhill. gather speedThe economic recovery was starting to gather speed.accelerateThe vehicle accelerated around the turn.

to cause something to be done or progress more quickly: We’ve got to expedite this order because they need it by tomorrow.
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cause something to be done more quickly: We're trying to expedite the process of reviewing applications. You pay more for expedited delivery.
